title: Bach Suites
description:
This module focuses on J.S. Bach’s solo instrumental works, with an emphasis on the dance suite. Selected works include the unaccompanied Sonata and Partitas for Violin, Cello Suites, and the Keyboard Suites. The contextual use of dance rhythms and forms in other Bach works, and neo-baroque trends in the 20th century will also be topics of discussion.

The module aims to bridge compositional thinking with performance and interpretative analysis. Thus, analysis, composition, and performance are represented as modes of learning. Major assessment is in the form of analytical
work and music compositions that are performed in class and/or public concerts.
prerequisite: Pass any 3 of these modules: MUT2201, MUT2202, MUT2203, MUT2204 and MUT2205; or YST Placement Test
